fr.ign.cogit.geoxygene.util.gl

Interface GLTexture

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicTexture, BinaryGradientTexture, ImageColormap, RasterImage

    public interface GLTexture
    Texture management. This class returns texture coordinates depending on the kind of texture type It maps 2D points to 2D texture coordinates paint method: texture.initializeRendering(), texture.finalizeRendering() shader usage: uniform sampler2D colorTexture1; in vec2 fragmentTextureCoord; vec4 tcolor = texture(colorTexture1, fragmentTextureCoord);
    Author:
    JeT

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Finalize rendering.

      double getScaleY()

      int getTextureWidth() 
      boolean initializeRendering(int programId)
      Texture initialization.
      void setTextureSlot(String name, int i)
      Assign a GL texture slot to this texture.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeRendering

        boolean initializeRendering(int programId)
        Texture initialization. This method must be called before vertexCoordinates() method calls It can use the current GLSL program Id (to set uniforms)
        Returns:
        true if texture is valid

      • finalizeRendering

        void finalizeRendering()
        Finalize rendering. After this call, vertexCoordinates() method calls returns unpredictive results

      • getTextureWidth

        int getTextureWidth()
        Returns:
        the texture image width (in pixels)

      • getTextureHeight

        int getTextureHeight()
        Returns:
        the texture image height (in pixels)

      • getScaleX

        double getScaleX()
        Returns:
        the texture image width (in pixels)

      • getScaleY

        double getScaleY()
        Returns:
        the texture image height (in pixels)

      • setTextureSlot

        void setTextureSlot(String name,
                    int i)
        Assign a GL texture slot to this texture.
        Parameters:

        i -
